title.rendered: Financial Commission Chairman Peter Tatarnikov to Participate in Roundtable of the State Duma Committee on Financial Markets Organized by the Association of Forex Dealers

content.rendered:
January 31st, 2018, The Financial Commission, a leading member-driven External Dispute Resolution (EDR) organization serving participants in global foreign exchange (forex), derivatives and cryptocurrency markets, announces the participation of its Chairman, Peter Tatarnikov in a roundtable discussion of the State Duma Committee on Financial Markets in Moscow, on Wednesday, January 31st.

 

 

The Financial Commission continues to develop relationships internationally with Self-Regulatory Organizations (SROs) and government bodies responsible for the regulation of the Forex market, including the AFD – a leading SRO based in Russian Federation that unites licensed forex-dealers and is officially licensed by the Bank of Russia, as well as the Russian State Duma Committee on Financial Markets in the lower house of Parliament.

The roundtable will be dedicated to several topics, including the repatriation of offshore Forex business and client protections, аs well as proposed amendments to current regulations to improve the competitiveness of the Russian market. During the session, Mr. Tatarnikov will discuss international practices in regulating derivative products, including Contracts for Difference (CFD). Separately, Mr. Tatarnikov will present an analysis of international legal and regulatory frameworks for the regulation of cryptocurrencies.

 

In anticipation of the discussion, Peter Tatarnikov said: “I’m pleased to participate in this important working session of the Committee on Financial Markets and look forward to sharing my expertise on international regulation of derivatives and cryptocurrencies, as well as proposed legislative amendments to improve FX market regulations in Russia. I’d like to thank the AFD for inviting me to join in the Committee’s discussion and hope to consult with Committee members on the important issues on the agenda.”

 

About State Duma Committee on Financial Markets

The main duties of the Committee are:

  • Active participation in legislative work aimed at improving the regulation of the financial market, improving the efficiency of public and private investments, and implementing other measures to develop the financial sector in the interests of the country’s economy
  • Drafting laws and resolutions of the State Duma on the regulation of the activities of credit organizations, insurance companies, infrastructure and stock market participants, institutional investors and other participants in the financial market, currency regulation and control
  • Consideration of issues related to the formation and implementation of the main areas of the unified state monetary policy

About Financial Commission

Financial Commission is an independent external dispute resolution (EDR) organization for market participants who are unable to resolve disputes directly with their financial services providers that are members of the Financial Commission. Financial Commission initially set out to provide a new approach for traders and brokers alike to resolve any issues that arise in the course of trading electronic markets such Foreign Exchange, and then expanded into CFDs and related derivatives, in addition to certifying technology platforms used for trading.

For more information please contact us at info@financialcommission.org
